ovdesc.p: A Live Record gets created in both COB & online level which shows the list of collection item details with the due details.

desc.p: Status of Customer. (Populated from CUSTOMER table).
Employer name of customer(Populated from CUSTOMER table).
One record for each defaulted customer
DAO Officer of Customer. (Populated from CUSTOMER table).
This field hold the Reference of the Overdue for PD and For AA, It keeps the AC balance type Reference.
This field will get populated as "FT".
Gender of Customer. (Populated from CUSTOMER table).
Home phone of Customer(Populated from CUSTOMER table).
Holds the No.of days after which an item is marked as inactive.
Holds the Outcome come to be used when marking item as inactive.
Action performed by the collector.
Whether the item is in an internal or external queue.
Status of the PD record as updated in the field PD STATUS for the collection item in specific.
Loan Status.
Mobile Number of customer(Populated from CUSTOMER table).
If the Queue is reassigned, corresponding new QUEUE will be populated here.
Customer has No.Of.Times broken the promise to pay.
Total number of dayï¿½s payment due is pending.
Free format text.
Overdue Currency.
This field hold information of the overdue start date.
Date when the ACTION field was updated for the last time.
Overdue Status.
Outcome of the action mentioned in the previous field.
Due amount will be entered in this field.
Outcome due date will be entered here.
Update the Overdue Reason if OVERDUE.REASON field set as "Y" in CL.OUTCOME.
Update automatically with the old value of the field QUEUE DATE whenever the later changes.
Populated automatically from the field ACTION DATE every time the record is accessed in input mode.
Populated automatically from the field ACTION TIME every time the record is accessed in input mode.
Populated automatically from the field ACTION CODE every time the record is accessed in input mode.
Populated from field BUCKET.
Time when the ACTION field was updated for the last time.
Populated automatically from the field COLLECTOR every time the record is accessed in input mode.
Populated from the field NO.OF.DAYS.PD.
Populated automatically from the field NOTES every time the record is accessed in input mode(multi-value).
Populated automatically from the field OUTCOME DUE AMOUNT every time the record is accessed in input mode.
Populated automatically from the field OUTCOME DUE DATE every time the record is accessed in input mode.
Populated automatically from the field OUTCOME CODE every time the record is accessed in input mode.
Update automatically with the old value of the field QUEUE whenever the later changes.
The promise to pay amount given by customer.
The collector who obtained the promise to pay from customer.
The promise to pay date given by customer.
This field holds the bucket number to which this item belongs.
The amount paid by customer after a promise to pay.
Should be an entry in the QUEUE record.
Date when the QUEUE field was updated for the last time.
Residence Region of the customer (Populated from CUSTOMER table).
Not in used.
Whether the item is in a selection based queue or not.
sum of the UL.OS.AMOUNT field.
sum of the OD.AMOUNT field.
Sum of the TOT.OVERDUE.AMT and TOT.OUTSTDING.AMT.
This field will be desired whether collector field holds existing value or New Collector
This field act as supervisor,when the field is having "N" then only system can reassign the queue and Collector.
Transaction Reference of the AA & PD contract.
It is used in future-Informs if loan is Secured or or not. Part of above multivalue set.
This field hold the information about outstanding Amount of the AA and PD.
Date when the record was updated for the last time through the end of day batch.
Weightage of the collection item.
Work phone of customer(Populated from CUSTOMER table).
It will be stored lastest action activity .Id Should be Collection Item Id with Sequence No.
Updated online automatically with the current collector ID whenever he enters an action code and outcome code.
Company Id of the Contract Reference.
Customer Sector. (Populated from CUSTOMER table).
